title: Request to Department of Energy for list of 2021 film collaborations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all the films that the Department of Energy has participated in the production of, in any capacity whatsoever, for the year 2021. I am  Any and all such lists, full or partial, would be appreciated and may include, but are not limited to, entertainment liaison (ELO) reports. I am especially interested in films and television shows permitted to film at the National Ignition Facility (NIF) located at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, or in any other locations in and around the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. I request that you search for these documents in any location where they might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ. 

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Materials for Decision No. 18,347 - Application of ADRIANNE RICKSON

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Materials for Decision No. 18,347 - Application of ADRIANNE RICKSON
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1.	The initial petition related to the decision “Application of ADRIANNE RICKSON for the removal of District Superintendent Anita Murphy; Senior Executive Officer Joseph P. Dragone; Deputy District Superintendent Lauren Gemmill; Board President John Phelan; Board Vice President Naomi Hoffman; and trustees Brian Backus, John Bergeron, Nancy delPrado, Kevin Kutzscher, Lynne Lenhardt, Matthew Tedeschi, and Bruce Tryon; and Board Coordinator Mary Beth Bruno of the Albany-Schoharie-Schenectady-Saratoga Board of Cooperative Educational Services” (Decision No. 18,347 dated October 2, 2023).
	2.	All evidence, materials, documents, correspondence, and any other items provided to the New York State Education Department (NYSED) and the Commissioner’s office in relation to the aforementioned decision.
	3.	Any and all materials, including but not limited to, supporting evidence, documents, correspondence, and other items provided by both the petitioner, ADRIANNE RICKSON, and the responding parties in relation to the aforementioned decision.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: MPIA Request for ZEEVIC Working Group Membership Selection Records

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: MPIA Request for ZEEVIC Working Group Membership Selection Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails and other records and communications related to the Zero Emission Electric Vehicle Infrastructure Council (ZEEVIC) Chair selecting and naming the members, Chairs, and technical advisors for ZEEVIC Working Groups including the Working Group that developed the ZEV Policy Scorecard and the Trucking MHDV Infrastructure Working Group. 

If all or any part of this request is denied, I request that I be provided with a written explanation that includes the reason for the denial, the legal authority justifying the denial, and my appeal rights. If you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the portions that can be disclosed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lanny Hartmann
